content: Hi Max. I’ve taken a great many online courses and share this view. Thanks for this. I think it’s great that humans have a thirst for continuously expanding their knowledge and feed their ever-growing curiosity, but this is only half of the definition of learning. The other half is applying the knowledge and putting it into practice. This is what learning is — and unfortunately not something a lot of people acknowledge yet. Learning is a process which involves three actions: discovery, understanding, practice. Online education has really been, for the most part, a reflection of the traditional classes conducted in onsite learning spaces and classrooms — with focus placed on content delivery / knowledge transfer. Just as the education space is being disrupted, I believe online education will see a shift in the model as well. In this article I’ve written I mention the future of online education — would be fantastic to get your opinions on this one, Max Lukominskyi.
